ISSUE.TITLE: Use database in backend
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: ## Description Currently the backend uses json to store tasks. It is flexible but less efficient when task size increases, as the backend have to store all tasks in memory. ## Solution Using external databases e.g. mongodb to store tasks. ## Benefits - Database operations are much more efficient than direct r/w to json. - It will be easier to implement an authentication backend described in #38. ## Drawbacks - It will be harder to write tasks and configure the server. - If SQL database is used, the database schema should be generated on the fly. ## Notes #29 should be resolved first to avoid extra setup procedures on the database. (use `docker-compose`)
